oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effects of selenium sources on blood and milk selenium concentration, glutathion peroxidase concentrations, and somatic cell count in Quebec dairy herds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jinane, Noureddine
Tison, Nicolas
DesCôteaux, Luc
Fournier, Alain
Couture, Yvon
Chorfi, Younès
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: selenium
organic
mastitis
somatic cell count
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Quebec is a selenium-deficient area (0.06 - 0.33 ppm) and most dairy farmers supplement their cows' rations with an inorganic form of selenium (Se); however, several studies have shown that organic Se is more effective in preventing mastitis, although most of these studies were conducted under controlled conditions with a limited number of cows. The objective of this study was to evaluate the effects of organic and inorganic Se on somatic cell count (as an indication ofmastitis) for a large number of cows under field conditions.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2012; 269
